posts.post_content:
You have one of the finest pair of eyes in the hobby
You have a distinguished collection of high grade
rare type cards and post cards.
You are willing to sell your items without any hassle,
and expect to command fair market value+++

This year alone we have secured 12 items from BST.
Whilst others talk or attempt to negotiate down for the
premiere items, we are ready to step up to the plate
and send the cash your way.

Right Now we are actively seeking:

1. G&B Gum SGC 5 or better
2. Yum Yum (photos only) SGC 5 or better
3. AWH Caramels SGC 5 or better
4. E 103- any non- HOF SGC/PSA 6 or better
5. E 104 SGC/PSA 5 or better
6. E 106 SGC/PSA 6 or better
7. E 222 SGC/PSA 5 or better
8. E 300 SGC/PSA 7 or better (we have 3 -send list)
9. T 204 PSA 8- we have 2 -send list
10. T 216- SGC/PSA 6 or better
11. T 227 - PSA SGC 7 or better
12. Stevens Firearms- SGC/PSA 5 or better
13. Lections - SGC/PSA 5 or better
14 George Miller Candy- PSA 6 or better- have 5 -send list
15. Topps 1958 - Ryne Duren PSA 8- will pay top dollar



Please write in confidence to

Bruce Dorskind
America's Premier Collector of Rare Type
[url]bdorskind@dorskindgroup.com[/url]


Help Us Fill "America's Toughest Want List"

I was wondering if you would be interested in this piece?

Regards,
ARCHIVE :p

Dear Mr. Dixon

Clearly, you must, that this piece is one of the cornerstone items of the distinguished Dorskind Collection.

The image you "pulled" was licensed to appear in a book authored by a leading still life photographer, Bret Wills.

We would prefer if you choose to select items from our collection, you contact us in advance for permission. 

By the way, which garters do you have? Or shall we ask what color garters
are you wearing today?

Bruce Dorskind
America's Toughest Want List

I just thought it was funny. I was hoping you would laugh with me. Oh well. Anyway, I "pulled" that picture from another post. It's on the internet, so I don't need your permission to re-post it in a forum. That being said, if you don't like it I won't post anymore pics from your collection. As far as my Garters, I don't have any. I'm one of those "Armpit Collectors" you like to talk about. My whole collection can be seen in the link in my signature. Feel free to use any images that you want to in your new book.

Robert, 

Every time you trash one of Bruce's threads, [STRIKE]the terrorists win[/STRIKE], I mean, he closes three more deals!

I believe the correct question is:

"Who are these guys???"


First time I heard that question...1969
May be really young for this but is that Starsky and Hutch there in the pic Jim????

Bruce--Looks like this one just sold on Ebay:

[url]http://cgi.ebay.com/1958-Topps-296-(R)-Ryne-Duren-PSA-8-(5815)_W0QQitemZ370314473532QQcmdZViewItemQQimsxZ20100103?IMSfp=TL100103006003r13022[/url]
I was at the premiere of that movie "Butch Cassidy and The Sundance Kid".
